page.title: 08A CLITHEROE BUS INSPECTOR
page.content: We asked a bus inspector at the Clitheroe Ribble Bus Depot when the last bus came in and where it came from. It came from Manchester and arrived back at the depot at twelve thirty a.m. We also asked who supplied the advertisements. He said that for the inside of the bus they had their own adverts about trips, holidays, commuter bus tickets and other different kinds of bus tickets. On the outside the adverts came from manufactures who worked locally. The adverts on the outside of the bus cost Â£2.00 a day. The buses travel to Manchester, Preston and Blackburn depots. These are the three main places. While 'Betty's Bus' does a route via Clitheroe, Downham, Waddington and other small isolated villages.
